parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
Probably from optanomai; a snake, figuratively, an artful malicious person, especially Satan.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
And if, even if, even, at least. From kai and ean; and if.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Deadly, mortal, fatal. From thanatos; fatal, i.e. Poisonous.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hurt, injure. A primary verb; properly, to hinder, i.e. to injure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Infirm, sick, ill, feeble, sickly. Infirm.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.
